questions.question: Scientists conduct many types of scientific investigations. Which statement is true?

choices.answer: There is more than one independent variable

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a qualitative observation?

choices.answer: A white pebble is speckled with gray spots
A pebble does not conduct an electric current
The volume of a pebble is 5.0cm^3

questions.question: What is a good way to increase the accuracy and validity of an experiment?

choices.answer: Do the experiment differently each time you repeat it
Conduct multiple trials and have another scientist repeat it
Analyze the results and organize them into a data table.
Repeat the experiment following a different set of steps

questions.question: Asking a question or identifying a problem to be investigated is which step of the Sci. Meth.?

choices.answer: Forming a Hypothesis and making predictions

questions.question: Determining what equipment, materials and technology will be needed is part of which step?

choices.answer: Forming a hypothesis and making predictions

questions.question: Deciding which aspects of the experiment to change, measure and control is part of which step?

choices.answer: Forming a Hypothesis and Making Prediction

questions.question: Recording information such as measurements, numbers and amounts is part of which step?
Creating a graph of the data collected to interpret the results would be which step?

choices.answer: Forming a Hypothesis and Making Predictions

questions.question: Forming a testable statement and then making predictions about what will happen is part of...

choices.answer: Forming a Hypothesis and Making Predictions

questions.question: Determining whether the results of an investigation support or contradict the hypothesis...

choices.answer: Forming a Hypothesis and Making Predictions

questions.question: Which term describes the information a scientist gathers during an investigation?
New data does not support a currently accepted Theory. What should the scientist do?

choices.answer: Change the data to fit the Theory
Do the experiment until the results match the Theory
Change the procedure so the results match the Theory
Form a new theory and plan further investigations

questions.question: Which source of information would be the most reliable about dieting and human health?

choices.answer: A magazine article by a restaurant critic
An ad in the health section of the news paper
A story on the internet by a food manufacturer
An article in a professional medical journal by a scientist

questions.question: What piece of equipment does a scientist use to measure temperature?
Which piece of equipment does a scientist use to observe single celled organisms?
A rat is fed peanut butter and one is not. After a month both rats are weighed. What is the IV?

choices.answer: The Amount of Exercise each rat gets

questions.question: A rat is fed peanut butter and one is not. After a month both rats are weighed. What is the DV?

choices.answer: The Amount of Exercise each rat gets

questions.question: A rat is fed peanut butter and one is not. After a month both rats are weighed. What is the CV?

choices.answer: The Amount of Exercise each rat gets

questions.question: Scientific investigations can be done many different ways, but what is the most important step?
Copper is a metal, penny's are coated in copper. Which is an qualitative observation of copper?

choices.answer: It is a good conductor of heat
It has a low electrical resistance
Its melting point is 1,984 degrees F
It has a shiny golden brown color

questions.question: The one part of an experiment that the scientist changes is the
The change that happens because of the independent variable is the...
The part of the experiment that the scientists measures and records is the...
The part(s) of the experiment that the scientists keeps constant and unchanging
